decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards using various discard outlets like Faithless Looting and Creeping Chill, then utilize the Dredge mechanic on cards like Stinkweed Imp and Life from the Loam to keep dredging and returning creatures like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam to the battlefield. This allows for explosive plays and combos, overwhelming the opponent with a continuous stream of threats and card advantage. The deck aims to win through a mix of fast aggression and resource denial using the graveyard as a powerful resource.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up +1/+1 counters on creatures using cards like Hardened Scales and Animation Module. This allows the creatures, primarily Arcbound Ravager and Hangarback Walker, to become larger threats on the battlefield. Cards like Steel Overseer and Throne of Geth help to further increase the counters on the creatures. The deck also includes ways to protect the creatures, such as Welding Jar and Metallic Mimic, while also utilizing artifacts like Mox Opal for ramp. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, growing army of powerful creatures.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on using efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Scavenging Ooze to apply pressure. The deck also utilizes hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to strip key cards from the opponent's hand. The planeswalkers Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope provide additional value and inevitability, while cards like Tireless Tracker and Tasigur, the Golden Fang help generate card advantage and board presence. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while mounting a fast and powerful offense.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of board wipes like Terminus and control spells like Cryptic Command and Path to Exile to deal with threats. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to generate card advantage and maintain board control. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw, this deck aims to control the pace of the game and outvalue opponents in the long run.

This deck is focused on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of small spirit creatures. The key strategy revolves around using Aether Vial and Collected Company to cheat creatures onto the battlefield at instant speed, disrupting the opponent's plans and quickly building a lethal board presence. The deck also features disruptive creatures like Spell Queller and Reflector Mage to further disrupt the opponent's plans, while Noble Hierarch provides mana acceleration for faster plays. The spirits in the deck have synergies with each other, with cards like Supreme Phantom and Drogskol Captain boosting the power and toughness of all spirits.

This deck focuses on using Hardened Scales to strengthen and proliferate +1/+1 counters on creatures such as Hangarback Walker and Walking Ballista. With support cards like Animation Module and Steel Overseer, the deck aims to quickly build a formidable board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. The inclusion of cards like Arcbound Ravager and Mox Opal allows for additional flexibility and power in combat situations. Overall, the goal of this deck is to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent through efficient use of +1/+1 counters and synergistic creature abilities.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Human creatures. By utilizing cards that provide mana acceleration and creature buffs, along with disruptive elements like Reflector Mage and Kitesail Freebooter, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. With a strong core of aggressive creatures and synergy between them, this deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying and buffing up Spirit creatures to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing cards like Drogskol Captain, Supreme Phantom, and Selfless Spirit, this deck aims to build a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Spell Queller and Path to Exile. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while cards like Smuggler's Copter provide additional card advantage and evasion. Overall, this deck seeks to outpace the opponent and control the game with a swarm of powerful Spirit creatures.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Spirit creatures. By utilizing cards like Spell Queller and Drogskol Captain, along with cards that provide mana acceleration like Noble Hierarch, this deck can quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. In addition, cards like Aether Vial and Collected Company allow for efficient creature deployment and maintaining card advantage. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Reflector Mage and Selfless Spirit adds versatility and protection for the deck's aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards that can be recurred easily, such as Prized Amalgam, Narcomoeba, and Bloodghast. Using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion, the player aims to dredge Life from the Loam and utilize its ability to return lands from the graveyard to their hand, triggering abilities of the aforementioned creatures. The end goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures coming back from the graveyard and dealing damage with cards like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate.

The deck focuses on assembling a fast and aggressive board presence by utilizing the human creature type. Cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant help pump up the team, while disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter disrupt the opponent's game plan. Aether Vial allows for cheating creatures into play at instant speed, while disruptive lands like Cavern of Souls help protect key creatures from countermagic. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and resilient attacking force.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with instants and sorceries while also utilizing cards like Faithless Looting to discard cards and bring back Arclight Phoenix. The goal is to swarm the board with aggressive creatures like Thing in the Ice and Arclight Phoenix to quickly end the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. With a mix of burn spells and card draw/filtering, this deck aims to consistently bring back Arclight Phoenix and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and creatures.

The key concept of this Spirit Aggro deck is to use disruptive creatures like Spell Queller and Selfless Spirit in combination with lord effects like Supreme Phantom and Drogskol Captain to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. The deck also utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and has a suite of countermagic in the form of Mausoleum Wanderer and Remorseful Cleric. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben slows down opponents' spells while creatures like Geist of Saint Traft provide additional beatdown potential. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast, resilient aggression backed by tribal synergies.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells to control the board early on while keeping up a steady stream of aggression. It emphasizes tempo plays with creatures like Delver of Secrets and Snapcaster Mage, backed up by removal spells like Lightning Bolt and counter magic like Remand. The deck also includes versatile creatures like Vendilion Clique and Nimble Obstructionist to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of burn, counterspells, and evasive creatures, this deck aims to apply pressure while keeping the opponent on the back foot.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with removal spells like Path to Exile and Terminus, while also countering opponent's spells with Negate and Mana Leak. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to generate advantage and card advantage. Rest in Peace and Field of Ruin disrupt graveyard strategies and nonbasic lands, respectively. The deck also includes a mix of draw spells like Opt and Hieroglyphic Illumination to maintain card advantage. The win condition is to ultimately control the game and outvalue the opponent with powerful threats and disruption.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's plans and ultimately win through card advantage and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Terminus and Path to Exile, as well as counter spells like Negate and Mana Leak. Card advantage is gained through draw spells like Serum Visions and Ancestral Vision, while Celestial Colonnade provides a win condition by attacking the opponent.
